memberdef.name: TwoDfold_solution
memberdef.initializer: vrna_sol_TwoD_t /* restore compatibility of struct rename */

briefdescription.para: Compute MFE's and representative for distance partitioning.

detaileddescription.para: This function computes the minimum free energies and a representative secondary structure for each distance class according to the two references specified in the datastructure 'vars'. The maximum basepair distance to each of both references may be set by the arguments 'distance1' and 'distance2', respectively. If both distance arguments are set to '-1', no restriction is assumed and the calculation is performed for each distance class possible.

The returned list contains an entry for each distance class. If a maximum basepair distance to either of the references was passed, an entry with k=l=-1 will be appended in the list, denoting the class where all structures exceeding the maximum will be thrown into. The end of the list is denoted by an attribute value of INF in the k-attribute of the list entry.

simplesect.para: vrna_fold_compound_TwoD(), vrna_fold_compound_free(), vrna_pf_TwoD() vrna_backtrack5_TwoD(), vrna_sol_TwoD_t, vrna_fold_compound_t

parameterdescription.para: The datastructure containing all precomputed folding attributes
maximum distance to reference1 (-1 means no restriction)
maximum distance to reference2 (-1 means no restriction)

simplesect.para: A list of minimum free energies (and corresponding structures) for each distance class

memberdef.argsstring: (vrna_fold_compound_t *fc, int k, int l, unsigned int j)
memberdef.name: vrna_backtrack5_TwoD

briefdescription.para: Backtrack a minimum free energy structure from a 5' section of specified length.

detaileddescription.para: This function allows one to backtrack a secondary structure beginning at the 5' end, a specified length and residing in a specific distance class. If the argument 'k' gets a value of -1, the structure that is backtracked is assumed to reside in the distance class where all structures exceeding the maximum basepair distance specified in vrna_mfe_TwoD() belong to.

simplesect.para: The argument 'vars' must contain precalculated energy values in the energy matrices, i.e. a call to vrna_mfe_TwoD() preceding this function is mandatory!

parameterdescription.para: The datastructure containing all precomputed folding attributes
The length in nucleotides beginning from the 5' end

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *seq, const char *structure1, const char *structure2, int circ)
memberdef.name: get_TwoDfold_variables

briefdescription.para: Get a structure of type TwoDfold_vars prefilled with current global settings.

detaileddescription.para: This function returns a datastructure of type TwoDfold_vars. The data fields inside the TwoDfold_vars are prefilled by global settings and all memory allocations necessary to start a computation are already done for the convenience of the user

simplesect.para: Make sure that the reference structures are compatible with the sequence according to Watson-Crick- and Wobble-base pairing

xrefdescription.para: Use the new API that relies on vrna_fold_compound_t and the corresponding functions vrna_fold_compound_TwoD(), vrna_mfe_TwoD(), and vrna_fold_compound_free() instead!

parameterdescription.para: The first reference structure in dot-bracket notation
The second reference structure in dot-bracket notation
A switch to indicate the assumption to fold a circular instead of linear RNA (0=OFF, 1=ON)

simplesect.para: A datastructure prefilled with folding options and allocated memory

briefdescription.para: Destroy a TwoDfold_vars datastructure without memory loss.

detaileddescription.para: This function free's all allocated memory that depends on the datastructure given.

xrefdescription.para: Use the new API that relies on vrna_fold_compound_t and the corresponding functions vrna_fold_compound_TwoD(), vrna_mfe_TwoD(), and vrna_fold_compound_free() instead!

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the datastructure to be destroyed

briefdescription.para: Compute MFE's and representative for distance partitioning.

detaileddescription.para: This function computes the minimum free energies and a representative secondary structure for each distance class according to the two references specified in the datastructure 'vars'. The maximum basepair distance to each of both references may be set by the arguments 'distance1' and 'distance2', respectively. If both distance arguments are set to '-1', no restriction is assumed and the calculation is performed for each distance class possible.

The returned list contains an entry for each distance class. If a maximum basepair distance to either of the references was passed, an entry with k=l=-1 will be appended in the list, denoting the class where all structures exceeding the maximum will be thrown into. The end of the list is denoted by an attribute value of INF in the k-attribute of the list entry.

xrefdescription.para: Use the new API that relies on vrna_fold_compound_t and the corresponding functions vrna_fold_compound_TwoD(), vrna_mfe_TwoD(), and vrna_fold_compound_free() instead!

parameterdescription.para: the datastructure containing all predefined folding attributes
maximum distance to reference1 (-1 means no restriction)
maximum distance to reference2 (-1 means no restriction)

memberdef.argsstring: (unsigned int j, int k, int l, TwoDfold_vars *vars)
memberdef.name: TwoDfold_backtrack_f5

briefdescription.para: Backtrack a minimum free energy structure from a 5' section of specified length.

detaileddescription.para: This function allows one to backtrack a secondary structure beginning at the 5' end, a specified length and residing in a specific distance class. If the argument 'k' gets a value of -1, the structure that is backtracked is assumed to reside in the distance class where all structures exceeding the maximum basepair distance specified in TwoDfold() belong to.

simplesect.para: The argument 'vars' must contain precalculated energy values in the energy matrices, i.e. a call to TwoDfold() preceding this function is mandatory!

xrefdescription.para: Use the new API that relies on vrna_fold_compound_t and the corresponding functions vrna_fold_compound_TwoD(), vrna_mfe_TwoD(), vrna_backtrack5_TwoD(), and vrna_fold_compound_free() instead!

parameterdescription.para: The length in nucleotides beginning from the 5' end
the datastructure containing all predefined folding attributes

briefdescription.para: MFE structures for base pair distance classes.
